title: What is a Microprocessor?
content:
A microprocessor is a central processing unit (CPU) on a single integrated circuit.
It's the "brain" of a computer, executing instructions and performing calculations.
Microprocessors are found in computers, smartphones, and many other electronic devices.
image_desc: A close-up image of a microprocessor chip, showing its intricate circuitry.
narration: Hi everyone, today we're going to learn about microprocessors.  In simple terms, a microprocessor is like the brain of a computer or any electronic device. It's a tiny chip, a single integrated circuit, that executes instructions and performs calculations.  You'll find microprocessors in everything from your phone to your laptop, even your car!  They're responsible for all the computing power these devices have.
